DOC.brief_summary: to assess safety, efficacy of Flexible ureteroscopy (FURS) holmium:YAG laser lithotripsy (LL) compared to extracorporeal shockwave lithotripsy (ESWL) in management of lower calyceal stones (LC) stones.
DOC.brief_title: Flexible Ureteroscopy Versus ESWL in the Management of Lower Calyceal Stones
DOC.detailed_description: to assess stone free rate, number of sessions and complications of flexible ureteroscopy holmium:YAG laser lithotripsy compared to extracorporeal shockwave lithotripsy in the management of lower calyceal stones less than 2 cm in size.
DOC.criteria: unilateral radiopaque stone(s) < 2 cm located in the lower calyx. Bleeding tendency distal obstruction Anomalies of the urinary tract Solitary kidney
